column4: Why does the Seamonkey-gui allow me to sign my own personal key(s)? Is it a bug, or is there some kind of purpose with this I don't grasp?
It's so you can make a new key, sign it with your old key, and then start using your new key with the same level of trust as the old key
Because your old key was trusted at some level so you signing your new key transfers that trust
